   19: %%
   20: %%
   21: -module(int_break_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %% Test break points.
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   30:          basic/1,delete_breakpoints/1]).
   31: 
   32: -export([auto_attach/1]).
   33: 
   34: suite() ->
   35:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   36:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   37: 
   38: all() ->
   39:     [basic,delete_breakpoints].
   40: 
   41: groups() ->
   42:     [].
   43: 
   44: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   45:     Config.
   46: 
   47: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   48:     ok.
   49: 
   50: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   54:     Config.
   55: 
   56: 
   57: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   58:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   59:     Mod = ordsets1,
   60:     {module,Mod} = int:i(filename:join(DataDir, Mod)),
   61:     ok = io:format("Interpreted modules: ~p", [int:interpreted()]),
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   65:     ok = io:format("Interpreted modules: ~p", [int:interpreted()]),
   66:     ok = int:auto_attach(false),
   67:     ok = int:no_break(),
   68:     ok = int:clear(),
   69:     ok.
   70: 
   71: %% Test auto_attach functions and setting breakpoints.
   72: basic(_Config) ->
   73:     int:auto_attach([init], {?MODULE,auto_attach}),
   74:     S1 = [] = ordsets1:new_set(),
   75:     ok = i:ib(ordsets1, 86),                    %Set one breakpoint.
   76:     S2 = [xxx] = ordsets1:add_element(xxx, S1),
   77:     S3 = [xxx,y] = ordsets1:add_element(y, S2),
   78:     ok = i:ib(ordsets1, union, 2),              %Set five breakpoints.
   79:     [xxx,y,z] = ordsets1:union(S3, [z]),
   80:     All = lists:sort(int:all_breaks()),
   81:     [{{ordsets1,86}, _}, {{ordsets1,_},_}|_] = All,
   82:     6 = length(All),
   83:     [] = lists:sort(int:all_breaks(foobar)),
   84:     All = lists:sort(int:all_breaks(ordsets1)),
   85:     ok.
   86: 
   87: auto_attach(Pid) ->
   88:     {ok, Meta} = int:attached(Pid),
   89:     io:format("Pid = ~p; Meta = ~p", [Pid,Meta]),
   90:     link(Meta),
   91:     attach_loop(Pid, Meta).
   92: 
   93: attach_loop(Pid, Meta) ->
   94:     receive
   95: 	Msg ->
   96: 	    io:format("attached: ~p", [Msg]),
   97: 	    attach_cmd(Msg, Pid, Meta),
   98: 	    attach_loop(Pid, Meta)
   99:     end.
  100: 
  101: attach_cmd({Meta,{break_at,ordsets1,36,2}}, _Pid, Meta) ->
  102:     int:meta(Meta, continue);
  103: attach_cmd({Meta,{break_at,ordsets1,87,_}}, _Pid, Meta) ->
  104:     int:meta(Meta, continue);
  105: attach_cmd({Meta,{break_at,ordsets1,Line,_}}, _Pid, Meta) when 107 =< Line, Line =< 115 ->
  106:     int:meta(Meta, finish);
  107: attach_cmd({Meta,{break_at,_Mod,_Line,_Other}}=Cmd, _Pid, Meta) ->
  108:     io:format("attached: no action for ~p", [Cmd]);
  109: attach_cmd(_, _Pid, _Meta) ->
  110:     ok.
  111: 
  112: %% Test that deleting breakpoints works.
  113: delete_breakpoints(_Config) ->
  114:     Mod = ordsets1,
  115: 
  116:     %% Testing deleting all breakpoints in all modules.
  117:     ok = i:ib(Mod, intersection, 2),            %Set five breakpoints.
  118:     5 = num_breaks(),
  119:     ok = int:no_break(),
  120:     0 = num_breaks(),
  121:     [b] = Mod:intersection([a,b,c], [b,d,e]),
  122: 
  123:     %% Set 10 breakpoints.
  124:     ok = i:ib(Mod, 89),                         %One breakpoint.
  125:     1 = num_breaks(),
  126:     ok = i:ib(Mod, union, 2),                   %Five breakpoints.
  127:     6 = num_breaks(),
  128:     ok = i:ib(Mod, del_element, 2),             %Four breakpoints.
  129:     10 = num_breaks(),
  130: 
  131:     %% Make sure that all breakpoints remain when deleting breakpoints
  132:     %% for another (non-existing) module.
  133:     ok = int:no_break(foobar),
  134:     [] = int:all_breaks(foobar),
  135:     10 = num_breaks(),
  136: 
  137:     %% Delete the breakpoint in ordsets1:add_element/2, line 89,
  138:     %% and testing calling it. If the breakpoint has not been removed
  139:     %% the call will hang and the test case will fail with a timetrap
  140:     %% timeout.
  141:     ok = int:delete_break(Mod, 89),
  142:     9 = num_breaks(),
  143:     [x] = Mod:add_element(x, []),
  144: 
  145:     %% Delete all breakpoints in ordsets1:del_element/2.
  146:     ok = int:del_break_in(Mod, del_element, 2),
  147:     5 = num_breaks(),
  148:     [a,b,d,e] = Mod:del_element(c, [a,b,c,d,e]),
  149: 
  150:     %% GH-7336: Deleting all breakpoints for a module didn't work.
  151:     ok = int:no_break(Mod),
  152:     [] = int:all_breaks(Mod),
  153:     [] = int:all_breaks(),
  154: 
  155:     %% All breakpoints should now be removed.
  156:     [x] = Mod:add_element(x, []),
  157:     [a,b,d,e] = Mod:del_element(c, [a,b,c,d,e]),
  158:     [a,b,c] = Mod:union([a,c], [a,b]),
  159: 
  160:     ok.
  161: 
  162: %% Return the number of breakpoints in the ordsets1 module.
  163: num_breaks() ->
  164:     %% Assumption: There are breakpoints only in the ordsets1 module.
  165:     Breaks = lists:sort(int:all_breaks()),
  166:     Breaks = lists:sort(int:all_breaks(ordsets1)),
  167:     length(Breaks).
